Item.name: Canister of Stabilozine
Item.description: A mild stimulant which is used as an ingredient in the manufacture of various chemicals.

Item.name: Pill Bottle of Stabilozine
Item.description: A mild stimulant which is used as an ingredient in the manufacture of various chemicals.

Item.name: Canister of Corrigodone
Item.description: Highly effective at treating various types of physical trauma.

Item.name: Pill Bottle of Corrigodone
Item.description: Highly effective at treating various types of physical trauma.

Item.name: Canister of Fibrinozine
Item.description: A hemostatic agent that slows down bleeding.

Item.name: Pill Bottle of Fibrinozine
Item.description: A hemostatic agent that slows down bleeding.

Item.name: Canister of Erythrozine
Item.description: Most commonly used for treating oxygen deprivation.

Item.name: Pill Bottle of Erythrozine
Item.description: Most commonly used for treating oxygen deprivation.

Item.name: Canister of Auxiliorizine
Item.description: A highly potent corrigodone-based stimulant.

Item.name: Pill Bottle of Auxiliorizine
Item.description: A highly potent corrigodone-based stimulant.

Item.name: Canister of Chloromydride
Item.description: A strong synaptic stimulant and cardiostimulant which is used as a preventative measure against critical condition. Should only be injected once every 30 seconds.

Item.name: Pill Bottle of Chloromydride
Item.description: A strong synaptic stimulant and cardiostimulant which is used as a preventative measure against critical condition. Should only be injected once every 30 seconds.

Item.name: Bottle of Biomass
Item.description: Carbon-based compounds made of organic matter from the remains of organisms such as plants and animals.

Item.name: Vial of Ethanol
Item.description: Ethanol is a volatile, flammable, colorless liquid. It is a psychoactive substance and is the principal type of alcohol found in alcoholic drinks.

Item.name: Vial of Ethylzine
Item.description: A substance that greatly helps against inebriation.

Item.name: Canister of Chlorine
Item.description: A noxious gas used mostly as chemical reagent.

Item.name: Canister of Chloral Hydrate
Item.description: A chemical reagent with sedative properties. Might be lethal in high doses.

Item.name: Pill Bottle of Chloral Hydrate
Item.description: A chemical reagent with sedative properties. Might be lethal in high doses.

Item.name: Canister of Midazolam
Item.description: Medication used for anesthesia, procedural sedation, trouble sleeping, and severe agitation.

Item.name: Pill Bottle of Midazolam
Item.description: Medication used for anesthesia, procedural sedation, trouble sleeping, and severe agitation.

Item.name: Canister of Hyperzine
Item.description: This drug quickly increases blood flow to muscles, output of the heart and lungs, pupil dilation, and blood sugar.

Item.name: Pill Bottle of Hyperzine
Item.description: This drug quickly increases blood flow to muscles, output of the heart and lungs, pupil dilation, and blood sugar.

Item.name: Canister of Neurozinide
Item.description: A highly potent neurotoxin that haywires neuro-cognitive functions.

Item.name: Pill Bottle of Neurozinide
Item.description: A highly potent neurotoxin that haywires neuro-cognitive functions.

Item.name: Canister of Morbusine
Item.description: A highly potent neurotoxin that reduces inhibitory transmissions in the nervous system resulting in muscular contractions and subsequent suffocation.

Item.name: Pill Bottle of Morbusine
Item.description: A highly potent neurotoxin that reduces inhibitory transmissions in the nervous system resulting in muscular contractions and subsequent suffocation.

Item.name: Vial of Morbusanide
Item.description: A morbusine antidote. It deals with the most severe effects but muscular contractions will still occur.

Item.name: Canister of Hematosine
Item.description: A highly potent neurotoxin that causes hemorrhage through all natural openings and wounds the victim might already have.

Item.name: Pill Bottle of Hematosine
Item.description: A highly potent neurotoxin that causes hemorrhage through all natural openings and wounds the victim might already have.

Item.name: Canister of Sufforin
Item.description: A devious poison with a delayed effect.

Item.name: Pill Bottle of Sufforin
Item.description: A devious poison with a delayed effect.

Item.name: Vial of Calyxanide
Item.description: An antiparasitic drug used in the treatment of husk parasite infections. Might require higher dosage to cure the infection at later stages.

Item.name: Canister of Oxygenite
Item.description: A mildy toxic solution that slowly releases oxygen into the bloodstream when injected.

Item.name: Pill Bottle of Oxygenite
Item.description: A mildy toxic solution that slowly releases oxygen into the bloodstream.

Item.name: Vial of Nitroglycerin
Item.description: A highly unstable liquid that may explode when subjected to heat or physical shock.
